item.title: Information Theory: A Tutorial Introduction
item.description: Shannon's mathematical theory of communication defines fundamental limits on how much information can be transmitted between the different components of any man-made or biological system. This paper is an informal but rigorous introduction to the main ideas implicit in Shannon's theory. An annotated reading list is provided for further reading.
item.author: ([Submitted on 16 Feb 2018 (v1), last revised 13 Jun 2019 (this version, v3)])

item.title: New free app tells you exactly why your PC may not get Windows 11 this fall
item.description: Forget Microsoft’s PC Health Check app as this new one from GitHub called WhyNotWin11 goes into much more detail about why your PC may not get Windows 11 later this year. The app is free and can auto-update if Microsoft revises its hardware requirements.
item.author: (Daniel Rubino)

item.title: Ideas | I am Palestinian. Here’s how Israel silences us on social media.
item.description: “The blackout Palestinians are facing is not about suppressing our voices as individuals. It is about erasing us in toto.”

item.title: So, You Want to Build a House More Efficiently?
